methods.name: getTab
methods.docs: Get a specific tab by the value of its tab property or an element reference.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: tab The tab instance to select. If passed a string, it should be the value of the tab's `tab` property.

methods.name: select
methods.docs: Select a tab by the value of its tab property or an element reference.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: tab The tab instance to select. If passed a string, it should be the value of the tab's `tab` property.

docs:
Tabs are a top level navigation component to implement a tab-based navigation.
The component is a container of individual [Tab](../tab/) components.

The `ion-tabs` component does not have any styling and works as a router outlet in order to handle navigation. It does not provide any UI feedback or mechanism to switch between tabs. In order to do so, an `ion-tab-bar` should be provided as a direct child of `ion-tabs`.

Both `ion-tabs` and `ion-tab-bar` can be used as standalone elements. They donâ€™t depend on each other to work, but they are usually used together in order to implement a tab-based navigation that behaves like a native app.

The `ion-tab-bar` needs a slot defined in order to be projected to the right place in an `ion-tabs` component.

docsTags.text: - Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: top - Content is placed at the top of the screen.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: bottom - Content is placed at the bottom of the screen.
docsTags.name: slot

events.docs: Emitted when the navigation has finished transitioning to a new component.
Emitted when the navigation is about to transition to a new component.

slots.docs: Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.

slots.name: bottom
slots.docs: Content is placed at the bottom of the screen.

slots.name: top
slots.docs: Content is placed at the top of the screen.
